Get Involved


Sehome Hill Arboretum would like to work with you! To improve education about conservation and help keep this site updated, there are a variety of projects you can tackle. The Sehome Hill Arboretum site can be a place of learning and growth for you and your greater community. Here are a few ideas of work you and your team can put together.

Ecological Restoration Club

The Ecological Restoration Club hosts weekly work parties in and around Sehome Hill Arboretum, offering a chance for students to get involved in restoration and land stewardship. Explore their website www.serwwu.org for more information on getting involved.

Also, please Explore Students for Ecological Restoration for more information.

Current Needs

  • Botanical sketching for the Plants and Fungi pages
  • Add info to the Fungi page
  • Fiction, non-fiction, and poetry about what the Arboretum means to you
  • Writing fun facts about each bird species found in the Arboretum
  • Soundscape recordings
  • Printable PDF field guides for flora and fauna
  • Interpretive information for website, signs, flyers, or geolocated information
  • VR video recording of a walk through the Arboretum
  • Grant writing
  • Organize an Event in the Arboretum
    • Please visit the City of Bellingham official webpage that describes how to obtain the correct permissions required to set up a formal event.
  • Any other ideas you can come up with!

Western Run Website

This website has been designed and written by Western Washington University (WWU) students, faculty, and staff to showcase the Sehome Hill Arboretum. We hope you enjoy exploring these links and learning about the Arboretum just as we have.

City of Bellingham Official Site
